Data objects for Tukelator

Source: vignettes/data.qmd 
library(tukelatoR)

mark-object form

The mark-object form is the main tibble type for the Tukelator app.

Each row is a mark, and the following columns are needed:

  • id: the student ID,
  • name: the student name,
  • course_id: the course code of the form DISPLINE-CAT_NO,
  • course_name: course name,
  • year: year of offering,
  • term: term of offering, in the form of Sem 1 etc,
  • mark: mark (integer),
  • grade: grade of mark, and
  • raa: RAA code - e.g. UR10.
head(mark_obj)
#>        id           name  course_id course_name year  term mark grade raa
#> 1 4547752 Xiong, Lindsay DISCP-1001    course-1 2020 Sem 1   69     C  NA
#> 2 4547752 Xiong, Lindsay DISCP-2001    course-2 2021 Sem 1   67     C  NA
#> 3 4547752 Xiong, Lindsay DISCP-2002    course-3 2021 Sem 2   70     C  NA
#> 4 4547752 Xiong, Lindsay DISCP-3001    course-4 2022 Sem 1   65     C  NA
#> 5 4547752 Xiong, Lindsay DISCP-3002    course-5 2022 Sem 1   56     P  NA
#> 6 4547752 Xiong, Lindsay DISCP-3003    course-6 2022 Sem 2   68     C  NA
#>       source
#> 1 simulation
#> 2 simulation
#> 3 simulation
#> 4 simulation
#> 5 simulation
#> 6 simulation

augmented-mark-object

Getting the data

To get data into the correct form, we have a collection of functions to parse the various data forms:

  • parse_peoplesoft() will convert the downloaded peoplesoft data (See Section 3.1) into a mark-obj tibble.

Downloading the Peoplesoft data.

To obtain the data from Peoplesoft, you perform the following:

  1. Go to Peoplesoft. Note that you will need to VPN in if you are using this from outside the Uni.
  2. Click on enrolment.
  3. Click on query and query viewer (left-side down the bottom).
  4. Use query EX_AC_GRP_RES_W_PLN
  5. Choose Run to Excel.
  6. Enter the fields as given in the Figure: Entry fields for Peoplesoft. Save this file into the folder raw data in the peoplesoft folder with correct year name.
